comments.html: Nicira has the same problem that VXLAN has...there is no native switch-router that talks this protocol where you can "escape the cloud" and bridge to a native VLAN/switch environment. Once our major network vendors provide a "interface vlan\n switchport vxlan(or openflow) <identifier>", that might be a "killer app". Until then, we dream of MPLS-speaking vSwitchRouters. :-)</identifier>
comments.name: Jonathan Topping

comments.html:
It just might be possible to get hardware termination of GRE tunnels working (need to check the encapsulation OVS uses), but since GRE tunnels mostly get implemented as point-to-point interfaces, the configuration would be a major beast.

However, if you're a cloud provider, you might not care - you give the customer the option of running yet another VM instance to do L3 routing or firewalling (like VMware does with vShield Edge). I still think virtual appliances are suboptimal, but you really don't care if you charge them by CPU cycles spent and the customers are willing to pay for that.
